description: From Ancient Greek συνδρομή (sundromḗ, “concurrence of symptoms, concourse”), from σύνδρομος (súndromos, “running together”), from συν- (sun-, “with”) + δρόμος (drómos, “running, course”).

entries.meaning: (pathology) A recognizable pattern of signs, symptoms and/or behaviours, especially of a disease or medical or psychological condition.
examples: Down syndrome; acquired immune deficiency syndrome; restless-leg syndrome; battered-wife syndrome

entries.meaning: Any set of characteristics regarded as identifying a certain type, condition, etc., usually adverse.
